description.narrative: The group will raise social, environmental, food, cultural, and political awareness and value of small farming and campesino groups and collectives. It will work to strengthen these groups' capacity, organize exchanges between farmers and producers throughout the country, facilitate and increase their visibility, and bring to the market a fair and just price. Specifically, the group will promote the concept of fair trade and solidarity through activities, forums, stories, and experiences in the HBA journal; bring together rural economic experiences and organizing meetings between producers to promote joint initiatives within the networks; open alternative market to support social economy and association for the producers; and bring to light the social, cultural, and political conflicts in these producer's communities and territories. It will organize meetings of small scale organic and natural products producers, experience exchanges, and publications of reports, interviews, and journal articles around collective knowledge, sustainable farming practices, the displacement of indigenous and campesino communities, the right to land, the impacts of monoculture, and related themes.
